ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Community and Healthcare Professionals - What is your job title?
Notes: 0 = Medical Doctor; 1 = Nurse; 2 = Psychiatrist; 3 = Psychologist; 4 = Counsellor; 5 = Community Health Worker; 6 = Social Worker; 7 = Social Auxiliary Worker; 8 = Lay worker; 9 = Other (please specify)

ElementDescription: Specify other care provider
How many years of experience do you have in this profession? - Years
How many years of experience do you have in this profession? - Months
What is your professional registration body?
Notes: 1 = HPCSA - Health Professions Council of South Africa; 2 = SACSSP - South African Council for Social Service Professions; 3 = SANC - South African Nursing Council; 4 = C4CSA - Council for the Counsellors; 5 = SACE - South African Council for Educators; 6 = Not registered; 7 = Other (please specify)

ElementDescription: Specify other professional registration body
How long have you been working for your organization? - Years
How long have you been working for your organization? - Months
What is your biological sex at birth?
What terms best express how you describe your gender identity: Man
What terms best express how you describe your gender identity: Woman
What terms best express how you describe your gender identity: Trans man/Transgender Man/FTM
What terms best express how you describe your gender identity: Trans woman/Transgender Woman/MTF
What best describes your gender? - Transsexual
What terms best express how you describe your gender identity? (Check all that apply): Genderqueer
What terms best express how you describe your gender identity: Non-binary
Notes: 0 = No; 1 = Yes; 99 = no data; -900 = Missing; -300 = N/A

ElementDescription: What best describes your gender? - Other
If you selected Other for gender you identify with, please describe.
What is your race?
Notes: 1= Black African; 2= Coloured; 3= White; 4= Asian/Indian; 5= Other

Age in years
Year of Birth

ElementDescription: Your highest level degree is in...?
Notes: 1 = Education; 2 = Medicine; 3 = Nursing; 4 = Psychology; 5 = Social work; 6 = Administration or business management; 7 = No specialty; 8 = Other

Years of experience (including present job) working with children and/or families (round to nearest year)

What is your current gender?
Notes: 1= Male; 2= Female; 3= TransMale/Transman; 4= TransFemale/Transwoman; 5= Genderqueer; 6= Additional category; 7= Decline to state; 8 = Gender variant, Gender non-conforming

ElementDescription: What is your gender? specify
In a typical work week, how frequently do you interact with the other consented providers?
Notes: 0 = Never or almost never; 1 = Rarely (1-2 times a week); 2 = Sometimes (several times a week); 3 = Often (at least once a day); 4 = Very often (multiple times a day)
